name: Blackbody-pumped Laser
imageDescription: Technical diagram showing a blackbody-pumped laser system with Ti:sapphire crystal, spherical mirrors, neon cushion, and a spinning liquid uranium reactor with beryllium moderator.

name: Fissile Aerosol Laser
imageDescription: Cross-section of a fissile aerosol laser showing xenon-fluoride or iodine gas chamber with curium fuel, aerosol fuel & fluorescer, MgF2 window, and coolant radiator system.

name: Cat Fusion Z-pinch Torch
imageDescription: Mobile processing vehicle with Z-pinch plasma torch using fractionally-charged particles or monopoles to process ores, with catalyst recovery system and wheeled chassis.

name: H-B Cat Inertial
imageDescription: Conical inertial fusion rocket with ion guns creating antiproton catalyst trap, shock absorbers, baseball magnet, and ablative material nozzle for microfusion propulsion.

name: Flywheel Tractor
imageDescription: Fleet of five solar-powered mining trucks with microwave rectenna, solar reflector, Archimedes screw, magnetic drum separator, and NiMH backup batteries for volatile storage.

name: Electrophoretic Sandworm
imageDescription: Large solar-powered rover with conveyor belt, Schaufelrad excavator, beam target, solar reflector panels, and radiators for electrophoretic helium-3 isotope extraction.

name: Free Electron Laser
imageDescription: 170-meter long free electron laser facility with electron gun injector, linear accelerator, storage ring, wiggler magnets, electron trap, and beam director.

name: Wakefield e-beam
imageDescription: Wakefield electron beam propulsion system showing plasma electrons, wakefield ion channel, field ionization zone, and beam electrons accelerating propellant on electrostatic waves.

name: Kuck Mosquito
imageDescription: Ice-mining spacecraft with thermal lance anchors, pump well screen, 40-ton water bag, H2-O2 rocket, and steam injector for drilling to ice cores and extracting water.

name: Ablative Laser
imageDescription: Spacecraft with compound parabolic mirror receiving powersat laser beam, reflecting it to a secondary mirror that ionizes solid propellant or ores for thrust.

name: MET Steamer
imageDescription: Microwave electrothermal steamer with discharge tube, MET cavity, solenoidal magnet, magnetic nozzle, and microwave probe heating water to 3100K using 400 METs.

name: Nanobot
imageDescription: 100-nanometer scale nanobot with sorting rotor, cam mechanism, positive and negative dee electrodes, rotor rim electrode, and electrostatic motor with articulated legs.

name: Neutral Beam
imageDescription: LINAC particle accelerator with proton source, DTL & RFQ injectors, superconducting linac with cryomodules, focusing magnets, power coupler waveguide, and laser neutralizer.

name: D-D Inertial Fusion
imageDescription: D-D inertial fusion engine with pulsed heavy water ice-pellet injector, magnet coils, ablative nozzle, pulsed lasers/particle beams, and mirrors creating micro-explosions at 5 microsecond intervals.

name: Nuclear Drill
imageDescription: Nuclear-powered drill with 100 MW reactor, gripper, 80 MN hydraulic thruster, coolant pump, Li heat pipe evaporator and condensers, melting rock at 1800K and depositing vitreous borehole lining.

name: Helical Railgun
imageDescription: Electromagnetic railgun launcher with rail brush, stator brush, armature, and helical current path firing slugs at 10 km/sec for spectroscopic plume analysis of sites.

name: Phase-Locked Diode Laser
imageDescription: Three-element 50x50 pumped Yb-doped diode laser array with p-type and n-type semiconductor layers, active layer, metal contact, and common heat sink producing polarized 658nm laser light.

name: Lorentz-Propelled Microprobe
ability: NANITES: One re-roll if fail 1 or more size rolls.
imageDescription: 1 cm squared 'spacecraft on a chip' with Ge solar panels, thin-film battery, sensor, radio, antenna, MPU, and 8m charge-carrying microfilament cathode for electrostatic propulsion.

name: Rock Splitter
imageDescription: 6-tonne radial-axial rock splitting rover with hydraulic cylinder, telemetry antenna, percussive drill, wedge and feather system, and geared wheels receiving 50kW remote or solar power.

name: MagBeam
ability: -1 ISRU, +3 thrust if pushed by Powersat.
imageDescription: MagBeam propulsion system with magnetic nozzles capturing Birkeland current from powersat plasma, quartz tube, Helmholz magnets, RF antenna, and self-focusing plasma beam.

name: Solar-pumped MHD Exciplex Laser
imageDescription: Solar-pumped laser with 1000X sunlight concentration, 1T MHD duct, master oscillator, power amplifier, CsXe plasma at 3000K flowing to turbine, producing UV laser output.

name: Quantum Cascade Laser
imageDescription: Quantum cascade laser with Ti/Pt/Au contact pads, 'Buckyball' fullerene layers, n-InP substrate, and Fabry-Perot resonator producing mid-IR 2 micrometer wavelength laser light.

name: Tungsten Resistojet
imageDescription: Resistojet thruster with tungsten resistor heating elements inside chamber, power feed connections, and H2 propellant exhaust nozzle, providing resistance heating to 3100K for ore beneficiation or thrust.

name: MITEE Arcjet
imageDescription: MITEE (Miniature Reactor Engine) arcjet with Am-242m pressure tubes, Li-H moderator, metal matrix fuel region, cathode, electric arc between anodes, and H2 inlet heated to monatomic state at 3200K.
